On Jan 5, 2005, at 10:15 AM, Kevin Klinemeier wrote:

> Does that mean that you don't include a coment for the test method?

Not unless I can't embed that same information in the test method name. 
  And if I can't do that, it usually means the test method is trying to 
test too much, so I'll look to decrease its responsibilities.

> FWIW again, I always include javadoc of the methods in my test
> classes, with a description of what the setUp is setting up, or what
> the test method is intended to do.

Have you tried communicating what a test method is intended to do in 
the name of the test method itself?  If so, what information have you 
found difficult to express in that medium for which JavaDoc helps?

Mike Clark
